articles.description: All the reaction, your views and analysis as Liverpool win the Premier League title.

articles.description: Liverpool's outpouring of emotion after clinching the Premier League title was a day of celebration 35 years in the making, writes Phil McNulty.
articles.title: Liverpool win Premier League: Anfield title joy 35 years in the making

articles.description: Chris Eubank Jr is discharged from hospital after he was admitted as a precaution following his victory over Conor Benn on Saturday.
articles.title: Eubank vs Benn: Chris Eubank Jr released from hospital

articles.description: Liverpool must still rebuild with major signings despite winning the Premier League, says BBC Sport chief football writer Phil McNulty.
articles.title: Liverpool win Premier League: Reds must rebuild with big signings

articles.description: Listen to live BBC Radio cricket commentary as Derbyshire play Middlesex on day four in the County Championship.

articles.description: The Atlanta Falcons apologise to Shedeur Sanders after their defensive co-ordinator's son helps to prank call the quarterback during the NFL Draft.
articles.title: Atlanta Falcons apologise to Shedeur Sanders over prank call

articles.description: Chris McLaughlin examines Celtic's dominance of Scottish football, what it means for the club, the rest of the league and city rivals Rangers.
articles.title: Celtic win title: Player trading, Europe & stability behind domination

articles.description: The extended Madrid Open reopens the debate about 12-day ATP Masters and WTA 1000 events - read more in your weekly tennis round-up.
articles.title: Second Serve: How Madrid Open's extended format has split opinions of ATP and WTA players

articles.description: Meet Grace Buckle, a unique heavyweight who wants to make the women's heaviest division as big as the men's.
articles.title: Boxing: Grace Buckle - the heavyweight who provides sign language for the biggest fights

articles.description: Britain's Daniel Dubois and Ukraine's Oleksandr Usyk will meet in an undisputed heavyweight contest at Wembley Stadium on 19 July.
articles.title: Usyk v Dubois: Daniel Dubois will fight Oleksandr Usyk at Wembley Stadium on 19 July
